alert.note: Alert for St. Joseph (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 20 at 9:27PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Michigan, including the following county, St. Joseph MI. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 924 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms between the towns of Constantine and Centreville. Radar estimates show between 1 to 2 inches of rain has already fallen. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Three Rivers, Constantine, Centreville, Nottawa, Mendon, Wasepi and Fishers Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
